item.title: Bangalore Service Jam on Vimeo
item.description:
Bangalore Service Jam on Vimeo

The Global Service Jam is much like a music jam, but only here we get together to design services. This is a 48 hrs marathon, when over the world cities engage and...

item.title: Design in the Public Sector: Cambridgeshire Council's insights - Part II
item.description:
Design in the Public Sector: Cambridgeshire Council's insights - Part II

Design Council's Design in the Public Sector programme increases the knowledge and use of strategic design skills across local authority public services, exposing teams to new ways of working and enabling them to do something practical to meet their challenges in a relatively short period of time.

item.title: Google's Guide To Designing With Empathy
item.description:
Google's Guide To Designing With Empathy

According to the World Health Organization, more than 1 billion people worldwide have a disability. To Astrid Weber and Jen Devins, Google's resident accessibility experts, that stat should be stamped on the back of every designer's hand, because it means that one out of every seven people on the planet is potentially left behind by thoughtless design decisions.

item.title: How to Create a Customer Journey Map -
item.description:
How to Create a Customer Journey Map -

Despite best intentions and mountains of data, many organizations continue to offer lackluster experiences for their customers. Many organizations function with an internal focus, and that becomes apparent when customers interact with their various products, services and employees. Every interaction a customer has with an organization has an effect on satisfaction, loyalty, and the bottom line.

item.title: HackFwd: Visualize Your Business Model in 15 Minutes Flat
item.description:
HackFwd: Visualize Your Business Model in 15 Minutes Flat

IDEO worked with HackFwd to develop this tool to help design and iterate startups. Download a high res version of the model at http://weijiblog.com/more-from-me/. This was heavily inspired by the work of Alex Osterwalder, Gary Hamel and Michael Porter. For questions or comments contact @thulme / thulme@ideo.com

item.title: Design Methods - toolkit Design Method Toolkit for multidisciplinary design research, developed by MediaLAB Amsterdam
item.description:
Design Methods - toolkit Design Method Toolkit for multidisciplinary design research, developed by MediaLAB Amsterdam

A one-on-one interview is an interview between a researcher and a participant in a face-to-face situation.

item.title: Design Thinking Comes of Age
item.description:
Design Thinking Comes of Age

Idea in Brief The Change Increasingly, corporations and professional services firms are working to create design-centric cultures. The Reason Many products, services, and processes are now technologically complex. People are not hardwired to deal well with high levels of complexity. They need help.

item.title: Uber Rebrands: The story of bits and atoms
item.description:
Uber Rebrands: The story of bits and atoms

But then why is there a disconnect? Is it just resistant to the change? I have been doing back and forth on this but there are some interesting perspectives to look at. Having a clear design vision or good start point for your design process is great, but how does Uber's product and marketing strategies convert into its visual renaissance?
